messages.message: Oo, is this on prod? I couldn't reproduce on sandbox, but @Serena do you know under what circumstance a gt set name might disappear? I've only ever seen an unclickable, but displayed name for gt sets that aren't ready to be opened (ie cancelled/in progress first run)
Yep, it was in prod. I'll try screen recording to see if I can repro. :brb:

EDIT: The below +1 bug actually resolved, it just took much longer than expected for status parity to occur

Couldn't repro, yet, but another bug popped up:
• I updated the underlying project/app
• (SS1) Went to GT datasets management page but noticed one was showing `READY TO USE` despite being now outdated
• (SS2) Clicked into the dataset in question and noticed the status shows contradictory (but correct) `OUTDATED`

I was able to repro the no-render issue:
• After re-running an app to address the `OUTDATED` status:
    ◦ Click the `review pencil` icon to review the results
    ◦ Mark as resolved
    ◦ Immediately go back to view datasets
    ◦ Encounter blank/no render issue
Zoom Clip showing repro (https://instabase.zoom.us/clips/share/A2F3MRZDSkIwV2NzRVM2bVBydE5BbXFtUEZ3AQ)
Passcode: d!SaNq19
i’m not able to reproduce on prod - can we hop on a quick screenshare?

Ah thanks for the diligent bug finding :pray: so we've got 2 bugs in this thread:
1. gt set status doesn't update after updating app until opening the gt set
    a. I think this is because the FE uses some cached gt set data, aka if you update app > go to gt set management > refresh, the status should be as expected. I imagine there are tradeoffs to always re-fetching status but @Serena is this a known bug
2. name render bug after a gt set re-run (not due to accuracy run test)

1a - yes this is expected
2 - we still need to investigate this
@Serena did you want to have a screenshare session? Happy to hop on
@Serena actually, when I go back to the 'review results' page and back out again to the GT datasets overview page, the link is still missing.
(refreshing does bring it back though, as noted)

ah i was using a project files gt set to test, and this bug never occurs for a project files gt set

i was able to reproduce on prod when after marking a document as reviewed for a gt set created with uploaded files

here are the steps to reproduce
• create a gt set by uploading files
    ◦ it actually doesn’t matter whether you create a gt set or rerun an existing outdated one
• open the human review page for this gt set
• mark a document as reviewed
• go back to the ground truth sets table
@pauline.comising can you add this check to the list of things to check in this UAT item (https://instabase.testmo.net/runs/view/66?group_id=426&test_id=42014)? we should have caught this during UAT :disappointed:
Ah got it, yep can do

this is why this bug occurs
1. when the user clicks “Mark document as reviewed”, the human review frontend calls  (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/098cc83/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/flow-review/components/FlowReviewResults/FlowReviewContainer.tsx#L335)`updateGroundTruth`
2. `updateGroundTruth` then sets the ground truth set’s name  (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/54b5b6d/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/hooks/appAccuracy/useUpdateGroundTruth.ts#L53)in the frontend’s cached state to `newName`, which is undefined in this call of `updateGroundTruth`
none of this code has been modified since ~3 months ago, so i think this bug has existed since GA :disappointed:
@Serena is it possible to fix this before the next prod push this weekend?
yep i can backport the fix to 24.48
